string.text: Tell me something interesting.

So one time I was with my team in Garbage and we were inspecting some old hangar. Everything was covered in dust and cobwebs, the place looked like shit. Our detectors stopped working; our PDAs couldn’t even show our own position. We occupied our usual positions: Sanyok scouting the front with us covering his back. Everything was going smoothly until all of a sudden, a bunch of metal beams fell from the roof. Sanyok managed to dodge them by some miracle. He fell, rolled back and without even standing back up started firing. The others were also scared shitless, and those idiots started shooting everywhere. Then, Sanyok started yelling something about a creature sitting in the corner. There was nothing there when I looked though.
 
Either way, it was clear that our operation was fucked. What happened after that was a total mess. Everyone was panicked, shooting at nothing thinking they saw something. Two of them were really unlucky. One guy was walking on what appeared to be flat ground until he disappeared down a dark hole. The other guy was crushed by a heavy metal door; his spine was turned into mush. After a while, we finally got our shit together, put on our psy-protection and tossed a smoke grenade towards every corner in hopes of luring the creature to the center. Well, it turned out this beast could fly and while we were all losing our shit on the ground, that bitch was just sitting up there watching us.
 
By the time we figured it out, it was too late. The beast knocked loose a few more steel beams from the scaffolding and splattered four of our guys. In the meantime, Sanyok heard ruffling in the rafters and fired in its direction without a second thought… Incredible reflexes. The beast screeched, and we started shooting where Sanyok landed his shot, bringing the bitch to the ground. Its bloodcurdling screeches left my ears ringing. Even after we ran out of ammo we kept beating the shit out of the creature with anything we could find, Sanyok finishing off the creature with his knife. When we were through, the beast was splattered all over the floor.
That’s one hell of a story.

You wanna know what I think? Or rather what I’m guessing? Maybe… Maybe all of this is just an experiment on humanity done by aliens. It kind of makes sense when you think about it… more than any of the other rumors people spread about this place. You know what’s interesting? Why did the Zone emerge here out of all places? If this place was just some military experiment, then why isn’t it better guarded and hidden? Are they checking which artifacts we want the most? What if these artifacts are actually bombs? Think about it: these artifacts are popping up in laboratories all over the world and in the hands of rich people. That would be cool, if some rich asshole would buy an artifact just to have it explode in his face. Ha ha ha!… anyway, who knows what’s really going on? The only people who really know are those made it past Radar. Yeah… They might know. Too bad they can’t say anything. All they do is moan and drool all day.
Yeah, anything is possible here.

We used to have this idiot with us. He was the laziest fuck to ever make it into the Zone. Whenever it was break time he was the first one near the campfire but when shit was about to go down he couldn’t be bothered to help out. Eventually, his laziness got him killed. His team spotted a controller and he couldn’t be bothered to get up from the warm campfire to save his own ass. The controller fried up his brains. People forget that this is the Zone and you can’t drop your guard here, not even for a second. You need to pay attention to every noise no matter how insignificant you think it is. You need to keep your guns cocked and loaded and your grenades ready to go. As for controllers, that’s a different story altogether. They’ll kill you before you even realize it. If you ever see a controller, even in the distance, get to cover immediately. They need to see you in order for them to start frying your brain and even when they see you they need a few seconds to concentrate. Once you are in cover lay down some suppressive fire and throw a few grenades to hold back the controller and distract him. While it’s busy figuring where all of that lead just came from, you run… Run as fast and as far away as possible.
Thanks for the story. I’ll keep that in mind.

Yeah, somebody told me about something the other day and I can’t remember what… Oh, yeah! Even though there are plenty of interesting materials in the Zone - the type any scientist would go crazy over - foreign scientists won’t go anywhere near the Zone. There are several reasons for it: first, why go yourself when you can hire a stalker for a small amount of cash to do your dirty work for you? Second, back a few years ago, there was actually a huge expedition from abroad that ended really badly… What, you didn’t hear about it? Strange…
 
Back when it happened, everybody in the Zone was talking about it. The expedition had 30 scientists from all over the world coming here. They all had a shitload of money and the best gear out there. They had a special military unit escorting them, mind you, these weren’t just regular grunts, I’m talking elite soldiers. They also hired some of our guides, three very experienced stalkers, to guide the way and they took a BTR just for the fuck of it. When they got back a week later, that BTR was wrecked to shit. It turned out the expedition was ambushed by bandit raiders who killed almost everyone from that expedition save for three people, two of our guides and one foreign scientist. That same scientist was severely traumatized and he had to be hospitalized in a mental institution. Right now he’s writing some kind of book about the Zone, and as for our guys, well, they just shrugged it off. Though, being honest, I think they went through some trauma as well. One guy went to Radar and disappeared and as for the other one, well, he just left the Zone.
 
You’re probably wondering how such a force could be taken down by a just a bandit ambush. That’s not the whole story, though.
 
Have you heard anything about City 32? They say that’s where the people of the expedition started to lose their mind. Some kind of mass hysteria spread from person to person and everyone started to lose their shit at the same time. Some even started scratching their throats out while others bashed their head on the wall. A few just shot themselves in the head instantly. To make matters worse - at the same time, a flock of large mutants showed up. Anyone who hadn’t yet lost their mind fled to nearby houses and barricaded themselves in. Can you imagine the situation? It’s midnight and pitch black outside, everyone has lost their minds, and at the same time a flock of powerful mutants is about to have you for dinner. Those who didn’t lose their sanity spent the entire night locked in abandoned houses waiting for morning to come. When morning finally came, chances were already slim. Some died in anomalies on the way back, and the rest encountered those bandits… I already told you how that ended. Since then, no scientific expedition has dared to set foot in the Zone.
Thanks for the story.

So I was in Dark Valley once and I wanted to scan the area from somewhere high. I found place where I could climb up, a chimney in a boiler station. So I entered the station, looked around and the coast seemed clear. I found the chimney and started climbing up - there was a ladder inside it already, so it was real easy. I was climbing up at my own ease since the ladder was real sturdy and comfortable. When I got to the top I slowly lifted myself on top of the chimney to get a better look. And man, what a beautiful view… It felt like the entire Dark Valley was in my hands. I took out my binoculars and started scanning the area, everything seemed clear.
 
Just as I was about to climb back down, it occurred to me that I should check what was happening beneath my feet. So I looked down around the station and man what do I see: A burer! Good thing I didn’t go down, I would have dead for sure. Lucky for me he didn’t see me yet or I wouldn’t be here to tell the tale. I wanted to snipe him with my AK but the chimney I climbed up from was way too thin and the AK was stuck on my back. As for trying to hit him with my Makarov, that’s almost impossible. Plus if I miss, and I will miss, the burer will notice me right away and kill me. So I was stuck there thinking of what to do while the burer was messing around in the station, throwing some metal garbage around. This continued about a minute until the dwarf froze in place, like he was listening in on something. Then the garbage started to move on its own and the burer jumped back and put his hands to his head in a very awkward position. Suddenly all the metal scrap in the building flew right into the burer, burying him underneath. I thought to myself, I am finally saved, that fucker is dead!
 
But no… That pile of trash was only still for a few seconds before it started to move again. Eventually the crap started to fly around in the air and then it flew into a nearby wall, smashing it with immense force. Then the burer entered a different building and I thought to myself, "It’s time to get the fuck out of here." Just as I began to climb down I started to smell smoke and feel intense heat. I look below me, and what do I see?… There’s a fire inside the fucking chimney! I was starting to suffocate so I climbed on top of the chimney where I could at least get some air. Mind you, the smoke was still irritating my eyes. Good thing I always carry 40 meter paracord with me, because I knew the only way out was to rappel down the chimney from the outside. I made a knot at the chimney and tied the rope around my waist and legs and slowly started to rappel down. The only thing that was going through my head at the time: Please don’t rip. The rope was cutting into my hands as I made my way down, but it didn’t rip. However, just as Murphy’s Law predicts, the rope was 5 meters too short and I had no choice but to cut myself free and fall the rest of the way down. Thankfully I didn’t break anything but I got torn up bad and busted up my right leg. I thought I ripped a tendon or something. I ran out of there as fast I could despite my leg hurting. Hell, I could’ve have won gold medal with that speed.
Damn, that’s intense.
Sorry, merc. I’m all out of stories.
Interesting story.
Come back another time, perhaps I’ll have something more interesting to tell you then…

Have you heard about Guide? The very first true stalker. He was the one who originally broke into the Zone and he’s still alive. People say he can take you to any place, you just need to name it. Now, finding him’s a bit tricky, ain’t no posters around with his address… And he won’t go with just anybody, either. From what I hear, he charges quite a bit. But if you find him and have enough cash, you can rest assured he’ll take you where you need to go. Now, that’s someone I’d like to have a chat with. You can bet he’s been past Red Forest…
Interesting information, thank you.

They say there’s this one gang… People call them Shamans or Druids. It’s said they don’t use any electronic equipment at all, they want to stay close to the nature and stuff… Well, they reason the Zone reacts stronger to equipment… To all this "electromagnetic emissions" or something… They say it attracts monsters. Basically, they believe the Zone is like a living being, you know. Like, it’s no good going into it with all these gadgets. If you’re right in your mind you’ll get by fine without ‘em. Doesn’t stop them from carrying assault rifles, though… Guess the old teeth and nails are not up to the task, eh? But then again, you don’t hear a lot of stories about one of them kicking the bucket. Well, at least no more than about us… So, who knows, maybe they are on the right track there… They seem to be coming more from the Belarussian side, though… I’d like to have a look at them one day and check out their pockets for some artifacts…
Thanks for the story.

Have you heard anything about the secret laboratories that are located deep within the Zone? Some say that they are still active. How the hell do this labs still remain active nobody knows, considering the fact that people can’t survive there due to lack of resources. Here’s a possibility: What if it’s not people working there but ghosts? I talked to this one guy, he hadn’t been in the laboratory himself but he did manage to catch some signals on his radio when he was in Yantar. He caught a conversation about some kind of laboratory. Another guy swore that he saw some kind of transparent figure when he was in Radar. It had some kind of upgraded SEVA suit and it told him to get the hell out of there and that he was interrupting some kind of important project. Although it was awfully close to the scorcher so the whole thing could have been a hallucination for all we know… On the other hand, there different kinds of mutations, maybe the Zone turned those lab workers into something else…
No idea. Anything is possible in this hellhole.

Yo merc you know anything about the Interception group? It’s a highly skilled special unit the goes on missions deep inside the Zone. They’re nothing like the dipshits we have here in cordon, these are real pros. Not only do they go into the most dangerous places inside the Zone but they stay there for months. They have a few hidden bases throughout the Zone and they have plenty of stashes to boot. They also get supply drops from a helicopter if they need it. Their commander’s last name is Gromov. I am sure it’s just a fake name. What you don’t believe? Belly caught their frequency once but he immediately turned it off and ran off. This is top secret info after all and he could have been shot just for listening in on it. Man their pay though, it’s something else. If I had a third, no, a tenth of their pay I could just retire somewhere in Sochi. They even have some kind of special device that can locate mutants from a far, no matter what kind. Some say that they even travel into the center of the Zone while others say they’ve learned how to tame mutants. There are also rumors that these guys aren’t military but rather they are highly gifted stalker who signed a contract with the government. Duty knows all about them but they won’t talk those assholes… They say it’s all rumors but trust me, they know better.
Don’t move! Password, now!
Swordfish. You might want take your finger off that trigger before you hurt yourself.

Almost. Valerian’s got a friend by the name of Belly. If he dies, we won’t be disappointed, and you’ll receive an additional bonus for disposing of him. After you complete the mission, contact me. I’ll show you where to meet us again.
Understood. I’m moving.
Okay. You must be Beast?
Yep. Let’s get straight to the point.
Let us. You probably know about the stalker base that’s by the railroad. Well, we need to get rid of their leader—for good.
Can’t you take him out yourself? I’d think all these soldiers could take on a stalker base.

We have our reasons. The thing is, we can’t kill every stalker in that base. That’ll attract too much attention. We need someone to eliminate Valerian without alerting anyone else. After that, the stalker base will fall apart on its own. I don’t care how you take him out as long as you do it quickly. This has to been done in no longer than three days.
What’s the pay?
Oh, don’t worry about that. The pay is good. You’ll get it once you finish the job—we don’t pay in advance.
Is that all?
Someone must’ve heard the gunfire. They probably told their men they were going to inspect the area around this vehicle station. This could cause some serious problems… What are your orders, Beast?
Don’t get too worked up, Raven; these aren’t Wolf’s people. We already informed the rookie village about our arrival. We should find out who sent those men here. And also, get rid of the bodies.
I’ll get on it. Anything else?
We need to have a word with Wolf and see if he knows anything about this.
Leave it to me. I’ll talk to the stalkers and see what they know.
I’m with you. I need to see Sidorovich and make sure he doesn’t find out that his job is just a cover.
Yeah? What the hell is so important that I can’t even lay down for twenty minutes without being bothered again?
A job. Get up.
Yeah, that would work… Do you have any tips on gaining their trust and listening in?

Christ. Act new and confused, and shorten information mentally. Avoid writing notes in plain sight. Write them when you know for sure you’re alone. Use acronyms to make your notes less incriminating if they find them. And remember that you have thirty million reasons to do your job well, if you ever want to actually make profit off of your assignments.
R-Right. You can trust me.

The target’s name is Father Valerian. After you’re done, go to the bus station near the grain elevator. Set up a low-visibility camp there and wait until I dead drop you further instructions. And don’t let me down.
Oh, is that you, Beast? I didn’t recognize you for a second. Sorry. What’s the job entail?
Gaining entry into that free stalker base.
That’s what they have the Syndicate doing nowadays?
I wasn’t done.
Oh. Sorry. Continue.

Once you’re in, *quietly* take out their leader and return. Gather basic information on their guard shift pattern, defensive location, armaments, and combat capabilities. Listen in on some of their conversations and see if they have any information we don’t, and then go in for the kill.

Uh, that’s a tall order for one agent, let alone a conscript. Not to mention I can’t get within ten feet feet of the base perimeter without fifty barrels aiming at me, so I would need extra equipment to make a disguise. How am I supposed to do this just as-is? They’ll know something’s wrong if I’ve got a fancy, unrusted gun but just a sweater.

It’s your duty as a member of the Syndicate to carry out your jobs no matter what kind of obstacles you face, regardless of whether you’re an agent or not. You’re contractually bound to handle these things with little to no outside support. You must act accordingly. Store your issued equipment in a well-concealed spot near the base in case you absolutely have to get to it quickly, scavenge a basic pistol off of someone, and make yourself look like a rookie. Gain their trust, thrust your knife into the leader’s carotid artery, clean up the blood spatter, and then leave without anyone knowing. The standard three-step-assault procedure.
Hey, merc. I take it you are the leader of the group at the ATP? Thanks for saving us from the bandits, you guys are real pros.
My partner told me that you want join the syndicate, is that true?
Yeah, it’s true. I am tired of working my ass off for pocket change. I want to make some real money.
Alright, but first you have to do a job for me. A test of loyalty.
What do I need to do? I'm ready for anything.
I need you to have the mechanic leave his workshop. Distract him, lead him away. It doesn't matter how, just get it done.

Hmm… I need to think. There might be one way, although he will only be gone for a short while. I can go to the bar and get drunk with him. Won't be the first time I get him under the influence. Will that work?
Yeah, as long as he empties more bottles than he could handle. Do you have enough cash?
Yeah, that won’t be a problem.
All right, get to it. Make sure he's passed out by night time.
Are you busy? Do you have time to talk?
No, I haven't got anything to do right now. I'm listening.
Fine, it’s your choice.
Do you need anyone to guard this place? Don’t you have anywhere to go?
Do you want something to drink? I have a spare bottle of vodka that I've been keeping for a special occasion.
Aren’t you tired? Don’t you want to take a nap for a little while? I can ask the bouncer to come guard the workshop while you're gone.
Ain't that a strange question… No, I don’t need to go anywhere and if I did I would send someone else to do it.
No, thank you. I don’t want any vodka. I don’t want sit here drunk off my ass while there is a special order waiting to be done.
Hmm… Why do you care exactly? No, I don’t want to sleep. I’ve had 8 energy drinks and I have the whole night ahead to work on a special order.
Whatever, It’s your choice.
Alright, It’s your choice.
Greetings, mercenary. Did everything go according to plan?
Wait, where’s the lieutenant? Or... Are you the one who ordered the contract?
Yes, indeed. I sent Yarishchuk to talk to you yesterday, just as a security measure, no offense, and I wanted to meet you personally today. So, how did everything go?
Smooth as butter, Valerian and his friends are dead. Here’s the proof.
Thank god that asshole is finally dead. Good work, merc. By the way, do you know a guy by the name of Scar? He's one of yours.
Nope, Don’t know him.

That’s too bad. He was also a professional, like you. It’s a shame he disappeared somewhere, no one knows where. Yeah I still remember how I was locked up in that base and Scar helped me escape. Man, That Valerian sure caused a lot of problems, to me, to the stalkers he claimed that he protected, and to Sidorovich. I was almost thrown in jail because of that cretin. Hell, we are still under investigation. Anyway, here’s your payment, you did a damn fine job.
Goodbye.
Hey, merc. Keep this conversation quiet, we can’t let anyone hear about this. Jackal has a very serious mission for you.
So you're the coordinator? I thought a secretive person like you would be doing something more serious than guarding a bar.

How about you stop fucking around and work on how you’re going to execute your mission. You have no idea how hard it was to work under this cover. For three weeks, I had to act like regular security guard just so they would start trusting me. All so I could get the needed info for your ungrateful ass.
Fine, tell me then, what Jackal has in store for me.

Okay, so about a month ago, Sidorovich managed to get his hands on a locked “Black Box” which was retrieved from a fallen military helicopter and someone’s willing to pay good money for it. Your mission is to steal the “Black Box”. Sidorovich keeps it in his storage room which is located here. Your main obstacle is Van, the local Technician, his workplace is near the entrance and you must neutralize him in order to get through. Van keeps drinking energy drinks and he barely sleeps… Oh and an important detail, you mustn’t kill him, it will attract too much attention. You only need to make sure he's passed out long enough for you to get the “Black Box”. Meanwhile, I will make sure the storage room door “accidentally” opens.
All right, if that’s everything, I’m going to discuss the mission with my partner.
One more thing, this needs to be done tonight! So hurry up and do what you got to do.
All right.
Not yet.
So, merc… How’s our mission going? Have you gotten the “black box” yet?
Yeah, Here it is. Here you go.

Excellent, you did your job well; the syndicate will take note of your success here. I’ll prepare an alibi for you in case Sidorovich gets suspicious and starts pointing the finger at you. Also, Jackal called, he said that he has another mission for you that’s ordered by the military
What’s the mission?

I have no idea. You will get all of your instructions from a representative of the client and remember, most important of all, In order for the military to identify you as their contractor you will need to say the password: “swordfish”.
All right, Give the coordinates for the meeting point.
I have given you everything I have. I don’t have no more info.
What up, Creature! He-he… So how’s Sidorovich’s contract going?
Have you forgotten who's in command here? Call me “creature” again and I’ll break your fucking jaw!

Yeah, sure you will. Though, you should probably remember what Jackal said about that… You remember, right? Anyway, back to the point, I called you here for a reason. You see, Jackal has gotten tired of waiting for you to do his personal contract, so he made someone else in charge and you, Creature, are supposed to drop everything and start doing his mission.
Like that, huh? Who did he put in charge by the way?

Me, In the meantime. But once Sidorovich’s contract is done Jackal will pick a new permanent commander. I don’t get one thing though, why the hell did he pick an idiot like you in the first place. You couldn’t even secure a good place for your team, not to mention your awful execution of the contracts.

Me, in the meantime, but once Sidorovich’s contract is done Jackal will pick a constant commander. I don’t get one thing though, why the hell did he pick an idiot like you in the first place. You couldn’t even secure a good place for your team, not to mention your awful execution of the contracts.
That’s none of your business… Anyway, tell Jackal that I will get his contract done. I’ll find Vektor and kill him.
Hello, merc. What’s up? Do you have Sidorovich’s package?
Yeah, I have it. Pay me first, then you'll get the package.
Heh, how careful of you… Don’t worry, I am not Sidorovich and when I say that I am going to pay someone, I pay that someone. Give me the package and I’ll give you the money.
Alright, here you go.

Okay, take your money. Take note of the fact that I've paid you twice the amount Sidorovich asked to pay you, I have my reasons. I have a feeling I’ll be stuck here for a while. Valerian has disappeared somewhere and its uncertain wither he will return or not and someone has to keep things in order here. Anyway, our trader needs your help. He asked to send you over to him. Go talk to him, see what he wants. He should pay you more than I have.
Okay, I’ll see what he wants.
Good day, merc. Any news?
One of our squads hasn’t responded for a few minutes. I fear something happened to them. I don’t have anyone else to send, so will you lend me a hand?
Of course I can lend you a hand... For a price.
Almost forgot who I’m talking to… We don’t have a lot of time for negotiations, Beast, so could you find those men ASAP? We’ll discuss payment after your return.
I’ll hold you to it. Where do I need to go?

They went over the hill, toward one of our outposts, but the problem is, that area was overrun with bandits not long ago. I see your gear is quite advanced, unlike ours, so a few bandits should be a piece of cake. I’ll mark the area on your PDA.
Got it. I’ll find your men.
Any news, merc? Did you find the missing squad?
Get out of here, merc!

Greetings, merc. I take it you received my message? I’m Wolf. To tell you the truth, we’re not really happy with your presence in these parts… I know you’re here on Sidorovich’s orders and all, but let’s try and make each others’ lives easier. Try not to meddle in anything that doesn’t concern you or your group in the Cordon. Understood?
I’ll get going.
Not yet, I’m on it.
Great job! Zokhan told me the whole story: about you saving him and his entire squad. I would never have thought a group of mercenaries would save our boys.
No need to thank me. Just pay me.
No, I feel I should, since mercs don’t care about anyone but themselves, from what I've seen. You, though… You’re something else. You actually do seem to care.
Don’t get the wrong idea. I’m only here to do my job and nothing more.
I got the message. Anyway, here’s the payment for the job. I don’t have a lot of money on me, so here’s an artifact as well. Hope it’ll be useful.
That all?
Yeah, that’s—oh, I almost forgot: Sidorovich told me he’s ready to take you. And, thanks again for your help.
Understood. I’m Beast, and this is Raven. Thanks for the warm welcome. What’s up with Sidorovich?
All right. I’ll get going.
Hello, merc. What do you need?
Sadly, the old man’s doing all right, but you’ll have to wait a while. He’s got some important business to attend to, and he won’t let anyone in his bunker for the time being.
When can I see him?
Not any time soon, that’s for sure. Sidorovich likes to take his sweet time with his business.
We’ll be on our way then. Please inform me when Sidorovich has a moment.
Wait, wait. Hold up. Can you help me with something?
Tell what that “something” is, and then we’ll see.

Listen, Beast, I didn’t call you here just to chit-chat. Not everyone’s accepting the fact that Jackal made you head of the group, especially Obscurant. He flew off the handle when he heard the news, and he’s not the only one who wanted to be in your position. Just be careful—who knows what goes on in that man’s head. He’s a dangerous, unpredictable man.
Thanks for your concern, but I can handle it.

Of course. Just be aware of the general consensus. If Jackal made you the commander, he must’ve had a specific reason, despite the disagreement of a number of individuals. A few well-done contracts will help strengthen your reputation, though.\n \nBy the way, we just got word from Vulture that an unknown group of stalkers is heading toward the base. They’ve ignored our warnings not to come here. Either way, it’s your call what to do with them.
All right. I’ll talk to them. Is that all?

No, that’s not all: the locals won’t be happy about our arrival here. If we want to stay on good terms with the area, we shouldn’t poke our noses into everything. The only place that welcomes us right now is the rookie village, but you know that already. That’s about it. I won’t keep you any longer.
Thanks for the briefing. I’ll go deal with our visitors.
You the man in charge here? What the hell are you doing in the Cordon? You know that mercs aren’t allowed here… or am I mistaken?
Indeed you are. The less you know, the better.

Listen here, merc: either you tell me what the hell you’re doing here or things are going to get ugly real quick. This isn’t your place, you don’t make the rules here, and if I were you, I’d fess up right now.
Was that a threat? What the hell are the three of you going to do against an entire platoon of mercenaries?
We’ll slaughter you all if it comes to that. Now state your business here! We don’t want any trouble now, do we?
Our business is our business, none of your business. Last chance.

*Your* last chance, you spineless piece of shit… You come into our territory making these crazy demands, and now you expect to get away with it? Nobody walks this territory but us, and you’re going to suffer the consequences.
Too bad. I warned you.
Hey there, merc! What brings you here?
I can ask you the same question. What are you doing here?
A psy-dog. I won’t give you its tail, but you can keep everything else. Deal?
Deal! Let’s go.

Me? I’m hunting a mutant. I’ve been tracking this creature all the way from the Agroprom, and no matter what I try, it always manages to slip away. This mutant is dangerous, but I have taken a mission from the scientists at Yantar, and I have to complete it. So anyway, I was sneaking up to it here as it was eating a dead stalker and the second it saw me, it ran away. That poor stalker suffered a terrible death.
I was looking for that stalker, did you search his body?
I searched him but I didn’t take anything, there wasn’t much to take. I’m just here trying to figure out where that mutant went.
When you were searching him, did you run across a flashdrive?
So that’s why you’re here… Sorry to break it to you, there was no flashdrive.
But?
There’s a chance that the mutant swallowed the flashdrive along with the guy’s leg. Since we don’t have any better option, I suggest we start looking for that mutant.
Yeah, okay, but first tell me what type of mutant we’re hunting here.
Oof, that was a strong one. I can finally wrap this mission up and get my reward from the scientists. How about you, did you find your flashdrive?
Yeah, you were right, the mutant ate it. Good thing that it didn’t start digesting the flashdrive yet.
It takes long to digest a flashdrive, so I wouldn’t worry about that. Alright, I have to get moving, I have to haul my ass all the way to Yantar now. Goodbye, merc and thanks for the help.
Goodbye.
Yeah. What do you need?
Wanna chit-chat a bit, while there aren’t any clients to bother you?
Sure. What do you want to know?
Tell me about yourself.

I’ve been buying and selling shit since before the fall of the Soviet Union. I was one of those “evil speculators”, and I used to buy and sell serious shit, the real deal. That was until I got caught and thrown in jail, that is. After that, I made friends with professional thieves in jail and started running with them when I got out. Got locked up again for another 3 years, and when I got out, the Soviet Union was already gone. Once I was free, it felt like a totally different world in which I couldn’t find my place in. For a long time, all I did was small time work and I was barely able to scrap together a living. Then the Zone appeared and there I found my place. Everything here is like the old days, and with my experience in trading, I will always able to make good living here.
Cool. Tell me something else.
Alright, I got to go.
What do you think about Logoped?

I’ll tell you this: Logoped won’t stay on top for long. I have a gut feeling that Koba will make him disappear. Logoped keeps showing off and, by the looks of it, he thinks he's untouchable. What’s worse he can’t notice the fact that a good chunk of us are getting sick of his shit. Remember though, I am telling you this because I trust you and this conversation needs to stay between us. By the way, if you find anything interesting about either Logoped or Koba, bring it here. Keep in mind though, it doesn’t matter who’s in control, I’ll still be here.
Tell me about Garbage.

Yeah, the guys weren’t happy about heading to the Garbage. Back then, nobody even thought about going there and avoided those radioactive heaps of junk like the piles of shit that they are. That was until a few stalkers decided to start digging through those mounds of junk, and after that everyone flocked there. At first there was massive chaos there, but then the bandits came, and they put everyone in their place. I think the Zone should be like any other “Zone”, with a clear hierarchy and firm rule, either instilled by cops or by bandits. Hedgehog here also pays to keep the peace around here and we get a good cut out of everything. We need to eat too. Maybe one day I will visit the Garbage myself, even though this place isn’t half bad, there’s some serious cash flowing through Garbage right now.
What's the latest news in the Zone?

I don’t like that expression, “latest news”. If I were you I would stop asking around, before one of those "latest news" become your last. Even though the people here aren’t that bad, not long ago something really fucked up happened. A stalker came in here, all scared shitless, pale and his hands were shaking. He and his friend were running away from a group of poltergeists and they ran into a flock of rodents. I think the wave of hairless rats were so terrible, that the guy got scared and shot his friend a few times in the back. So then, the rodents, instead of running after him decided to just eat his dead bro. The guy that came back, after he drank his second bottle started crying his heart out. “Igor, you gave me your last medkit that one time, and I killed you like the last piece of shit on earth”. He was crying all day long and when the night came he hung himself on his belt.
Yeah, not that interesting really.
Whatever you say.
Why is this place called Bar No92?

It’s simply because in the periodic table of elements, No 92 is Uranium, which is usually used in nuclear reactors. I think it was Sidorovich’s idea... Hey, at least you gotta admit that it’s pretty original. Me and Sidorovich should copyright this name and sell it to some big shot from Moscow. He would then open a bar with the same name with some Zone decorations: a few artifacts, a stuffed rodent, some worn out chimes and a tooth from a pseudogiant. That place would bring a lot of clients and me along with Sidorovich would get rich just by getting a small fraction of the business’s earnings.
So Shaman, is this enough muscle for you?
Yes, this enough, thanks for your help; I’ll pay 1500 for each guard just like we agreed.
Yes, this enough, thanks for your help; I’ll pay 2500 for each guard just like we agreed.
Yes, this enough, thanks for your help; I’ll pay 3500 for each guard just like we agreed.
Pleasure doing business with you, goodbye.
Sidorovich said that you might have a job for me. What problem do you need taken care of?
Problem? I don’t have any problems. I just need a bit more security in my bar, can you help with that?
All right, 2500 for each guard.
All right, 3500 for each guard.
No, I Wont lower the rent price.
In that case no deal. Forgot about this conversation; I guess I’ll have to make do with what I got.
Whatever you say.
All right, that’s an affordable price. We need four people with their own gear sense I have none to spare.
All right, they’ll come soon.
I can send a few people your way, for some cash of course. It will take some time for them to get here though.
All right, Money isn’t a problem. How much for each head?
1500 for each guard.
2500 for each guard
3500 for each guard
5000 for each guard
No, merc, that’s too much. Perhaps you could lower the price a bit?
fine. 1500 for each guard.
Tell me about the Zone.

Do I look like an egghead? They’re the ones who study the Zone under the microscope. Me, I don’t know much about this place. I am only interested in making money here and that’s what I’m doing. So that after a few years I could afford my own piece of land with a grapevine near the lake.
I’d like to rent a bed.
No problem, it will cost you 2500 for a day. I don’t rent them out for more than a day, if you need it for longer come back later and pay me for the next day.
All right, here you go.
Nah, I’ll pass.
Excellent, your bed is located to the right of the entrance of the bedroom. There is also a footlocker near your bed where you can put your stuff in.
Whatever your say, it’s your choice.
Greetings, merc! You have just entered the bar with the biggest assortment of food and drinks in the whole Zone. Welcome and enjoy your stay.
Hi, merc. Do you want a drink?
Dude, do me a solid, turn off the radio.

Yeah, sure I can, just not for free. A lot of people here want to listen to the radio so you’re gonna have to pay up, 500 rubles to be exact. Once you pay, I will turn the radio off but keep in my mind that once you leave the bar I am turning it back on.
Fine, here’s your 500 ru.
I changed my mind.
Pleasure doing buisness with you!
Whatever, your call.
Can you turn on the radio?
Changed your mind, eh? Here you go!
There, I turned it on.
Listen to as much as you want, I don’t mind but if you want me turn it off you’re gonna have to pay again.
Hey!
I want to take what I ordered.

Here, “Desert Eagle”! I had to fiddle with it a bit… One collector really wanted this gun so I had to steal right from under his nose. Take a look at it: it’s handmade; every piece is carved out like jewelry. This handgun has the range of a sniper rifle and is just as accurate. You owe me 2800.
All right, here you go.
Pleasure doing buisness!
I don’t have that much cash right now.
Well, I can hold then to the product for a while, let’s hope you find the money in time.
I don’t want to buy it.
If you refuse to take the product then that means I won’t be able to trust you next time and I’ll charge you extra on your next order. Getting your hands on these guns is risky as it is.
Eitherway, I won’t take it.
Fine, it’s your choice.
I’ll think about it.
Whatever you want… I’ll hold on to your order in the meantime.
Here you go, a “Desert Eagle,” a heavy, accurate killing machine. That’ll be 2800.

The “Alpine”, a unique model of the Sig P229 handgun. Part of a small limited edition made for an unidentified special forces unit. The model benefits from an increased magazine capacity, a high durability steel barrel, and an ultra-durable polymer frame. 2800 and it’s yours.
Here an “Alpine” with an increased mag capacity, 2800 and it’s yours.

Take a look at this, a “March”. It used to belong to a mercenary named wolfhound. It is a compact, large caliber pistol with short bolt movement and lightweight bolt assembly. Even though, Wolfhound is a complete psycho, he knows his way around a gun. They say that Wolfhound used to execute people in a really brutal way with this handgun. He would start off by shooting off all of their 4 limbs and once they fall on the ground he would shoot them in the head… Yeah, sick shit. Anyway, it will cost 2800.
Here’s your “March,” that’ll be 2800.

Take a look at this: “Frasier”. Don’t let the old look fool you, this gun is brand new. This one isn’t even part of a series; it’s a unique prototype and it’s completely handmade. It has a large caliber, an insanely fast fire rate, and it’s really accurate. It’ll cost you 8000.
Yeah, here’s your “Frasier”, that will be 8000.

Check this out: “Carabiner”, An army shotgun designed specifically for assault units on the basis of the SPSA-14. Capable of automatic fire like its predecessor, but provides better recoil compensation thanks to a balanced shock free system. 8000 rubles and it’s yours.
Here you go: One “Carabiner” for 8000.

I bet you’ll like this. “Eliminator”, one of the most modern inventions! A shipment of these was supposed to be sent to central Africa but a guy who worked for me managed to steal one. It’s an automatic shotgun with a very large mag capacity and an excellent fire rate. 8000 and it’s yours.
Of course, An “Eliminator” for 8000 rubles.

Here: An automatic grenade launcher called “storm”. This is a modified version made especially for elite military stalkers. Wonderful piece of technology made by our brother slaves… 16000 and it’s yours.
Here’s Your “storm” with an extended mag. That’ll be 16000.

Take a look at this: The GP37, The assault rifle of the future. It’s accurate, Reliable, powerful, and it has a built in scope. It used to belong to a soldier who was part of expedition sent by the UN, They were sent here to figure what was going on here. I’ll sell this rifle for 16000.
Here you go, the GP37, the assualt rifle of the future. That’ll be 16000.

One sec! Here: an FT-200M, a creation of beguine weapon manufacturers. An accurate, universal, fully ambidextrous so it you can shoot it with both hands… It also has a built in scope and grenade launcher. I got it from a UN soldier. That’ll be 16000.
Here’s your FT-200M, for 16000.

Here, “tide”. Based on the Vintar BS, a silent sniper rifle, it was made especially for fighting zombies and was supposed to be given out to military units who fought them. This model, although has slower fire rate but compensates with heavier fire power so that a zombie hit by its bullet would die instantly. However, in the end the rifle never made into the hands of soldiers sense it was discovered that zombies don’t really go anywhere past the barrier. If you want, this rifle can be yours for 16000.
Here, “tide”. A slienced sniper rifle with increased damage and it’s yours for 16000.

Here, an SVU2-A, a shortened sniper rifle with an increased fire-rate. I bought it from Max, a legendary stalker from the freedom faction. He said that this rifle is one of a kind throughout the whole Zone and even if he lied, I doubt you will find another one in these parts. 16000 and it’s yours.
Yeah, here you go. SVU2-A, a shortened sniper rifle with an increased fire-rate. That’ll be 16000.

Of course. Here, look: “Lynx”, it was handmade by a professional who is now dead and no one else can make one like it so this one is really rare. Even though it doesn’t differ from a regular SVD by appearance it’s stopping power and accuracy are far greater than that of the original. I’ll take 16000 for it.
Yeah, “Lynx.” A highly accurate and powerful sniper rifle. That’ll be 16000.

Look here, I managed to get what I planned: CH-3a and its helmet. The helmet, on its own, isn’t anything special but it can be upgraded to a pretty good one. As for the CH-3a itself, that’s a different story. This armor has a strong defense against both bullets and anomalies and yet its user can remain totally mobile which is a rare case. 32000 for both the armor and the helmet.
Here you go, CH-3a and it’s helmet. I’ll take 32000 for both of them.

Especially for you, Seva suit, just like you ordered. This armor has a built in breathing system, an electric shock protection system, an anti-corrosive layer on its surface and it’s fireproof. As a bonus it also has a built in artifact container, a thing that is essential for any stalker. Just like we agreed, this suit will cost you 24000 rubles.
Here’s your Seva suit. That’ll be 24000, just like we agreed.

Here it is, a mercenary exoskeleton, I only managed to find one of these! Its protection against bullets, explosions, and mutant bites is the best in whole Zone, with a few very rare exceptions. It has a huge weight capacity so you don’t need worry about overloading yourself. You can have it for 48000, and I’ll even throw in a free battery.
Here it is, mercenary exoskeleton, I’ll sell it for 48000.
I Would like to make an order.
No Problem, What do need?
A pistol.
Easy. A pistol will cost 3500, with 700 given in advance.
All right, here you go.
I’ll contact when your order is ready.
I don’t have the money right now.
Okay then… Comeback when you have skrilla.
You know what? I changed my mind.
Aight, comeback if you need anything.
Well, you aren’t a reliable buyer so I am going to charge you 4200 for the pistol with 1400 given in advance.
I am afraid that I’ve sold all my good pistols, and as for shitty ones, you can buy those from Owl.
Weapons for close range combat.
Easy, that’ll cost you 10000, with 2000 given to me in advance.
Îò ïðåäûäóùåãî çàêàçà òû îòêàçàëñÿ… Çíà÷èò, ýòîò îáîéäåòñÿ òåáå â 12000, ïðè÷åì 4000 ïîíàäîáÿòñÿ ñðàçó.
Sorry, I can’t help you with that. I already sold everything.
Assualt rifles.
Okay, the regular price is 20000 and from it I will take 4000 in advance. What do you say?
You’re difficult to work with, so for you the price will be 24000, 8000 of which I will take in advance.

There’s a problem with that. right now, the soldiers at cordon are pissed and I can’t do business with them. Someone attacked their outpost not long ago and now they refusing to do business with stalkers, however this should be handled soon though.
Sniper rifles.
I could get you one for 20000, with 4000 in advance.
And how do I know you won’t change your mind… Sense you are an unreliable client I’m going to charge 24000 for it, and I’ll take 8000 in advance.
Sorry, not right now. The guy who gets these rifles for me got… Uhh… Sick.
Armor.
Armor eh? I could get you one for 40000, but I’ll take 8000 in advance.
I have a few armors lying around but sense you reneged on our last deal, I am going to charge you 48000 for it and I’ll take 16000 in advance.
I couldn’t get anything good, and the last armor you took was the last one I had.
A suit with a closed off breathing system.
That’s a rare order… I could try and get one for 30000, but you’re gonna have to pay me 6000 in advance.
Sense you backed out on that last deal so I’m going to charge you extra for it. I’m going to try and get one for 36000 and you’re going to pay me 12000 in advance.
I could barely get that last one and right now I have nowhere to get another one.
mercenary exoskeleton.
That’s a serious deal… I think I can manage to get just for you but it will cost 60000 rubles, don’t worry it’s worth it and I will take 12000 in advance.
Sense you backed out on our last deal, for such a serious order I will charge 72000. Keep in mind that I will take 24000 in advance.
Not a chance. Sense the factory that produces these exos was closed, the only way to get one is too take one off a dead body but that’s not the way I work. .
Still nothin’.
Sorry, I can’t do any orders right. Temporary difficulties…

Greetings, Beast, if you need any weapons or gear, you came to the right place. I can get my hands on even the rarest prototypes, some of the best out there. Each order is handled by me personally so they are always top quality.
Hey, What do want to order?
Hey.
You order will be ready soon.
You order is up, you can take it.
Sidorovich asked me to find this courier; I didn’t expect to find him dead. My sympathies, man.
Damn… He was one of the good ones; I’ve been through a lot of shit with this guy. You’d think this would be the last place he’d die sense cordon is the safest place in the Zone and yet here he is…
Did you see who killed him?
Did you find anything else interesting?
Did you search his backpack?
All right, did you know this stalker?
I found a pda in his backpack but it’s locked. Do you know by any chance anyone who can hack it?

Nope, I don’t know nor have I seen who did it. I accidently caught the signal of his pda when I was walking by and he wasn’t answering. So I came here in order to check it out. I thought maybe he dropped his pda or something.
Yeah, this is a sad turn of events but what’s done is done.
Man, what assholes! Why would somebody do such a thing? Fuck, I told him not to take that damn job, that it was too risky, but no he had to go and get himself killed. Anyway, what do you need?
No, I haven’t searched his backpack yet, I doubt there’s anything valuable there.
Yeah, I knew him well and I used to help him with his courier jobs from time to time. He was a good, kind stalker; I don’t know why some would kill him.
I don’t know for sure but I think wagon can help with that, you should ask him.
Well, I am going to search him, he might have something that I need.
I feel you.
All right, I’ll ask him.
All right, that’s all I needed to know, good luck out there.
Did you know this guy?
Yeah, I knew him well and I used to help him with his courier jobs from time to time. He was a good, kind stalker; I don’t know why some would kill him.
Who could do this?
text in default
Sidorovich, some say you sell info, is that true?
Yeah… Nevermind.
What can tell me about Shaman?
500 rubles and I tell you all I know.
Okay, here.

Shaman’s a good guy, he used to be in some kind of special force unit or something… He is nowhere near Wolf but he still knows his way around the Zone and his been around for more than a year now. Most stalkers can learn a lot from him especially new ones. He’s a real leader and keeps all the stalkers here in line and make sure that they are covering each other’s back. He is also a good strategist and always knows how to solve a problem by using his head. Anyway, good stalker and I’m glad he’s here.
Do you know anything about Mark?
500 rubles and all the hot goss is yours…
What do you know about Borland?
Depends what info… Tell me what you need to know and then we will see if I can help you.
The price for such info is always the same, 500.
Got change for a 1000?

According to the rumors, Borland wasn’t a soldier nor was he a scientist. Rather he was a thirty-two year old professional racer. Due the mess that was going on his country every race track and stadium was closed and Borland was forced to find something else to do with his life. He quickly understood that the only place for him is the Zone. All of his talents are useful here. His dexterous eyes and hands, his ability to remain cool in dangerous situations, and his stamina all serve him well here in the Zone. Borland had the ability to find the solution to any problem on the fly no matter how tough and he had great sense of time and distance. Really the Zone was nothing new for him; it was all the same except the stakes were a bit higher.
I heard about this guy named Fang. You wouldn’t happen to know anything about him?
Î, Ñàâàí, ýòî òû î êîì íàäî ñïðîñèë. Äàâàé 500 ðóáëåé è ñëóøàé.
I am all ears.

Fang is a legendry stalker. In strelok’s group he was the muscle, he would take care of anything combat related. He was a terrific shot and more than that he was also really smart when it came to technology. He upgraded his own exoskeleton and made it the best in the whole Zone. Too bad he disappeared somewhere, nobody knows for sure. Some say that he died while others say that he simply left the Zone. I can’t tell you, I don’t know.
Do you know anything strelok’s group? How about Ghost.
I’ll tell for 500 rubles.
Here.
What do you know about Wolf? Who is he, how did get here, etc.

Ghost was something of a spy, he could sneak anywhere undetected; he wasn’t called ghost for nothing. Too bad he is no longer with us. He died in the laboratory that’s located in Yantar. He was a good stalker, maybe one of the best.
info costs money pal, so fork over 500 rubles.
Whatever you say…
Don’t you think that’s a tad bit much? I’ll pass.

Sergey Ykimov (Wolf) and his family were always in a bad shape. His wife left him in the same time that he got fired. At first all he did was get wasted, drinking all day and night but once after his brother, Peter, got in too trouble things changed. Peter had been badly beat up, his nose was broken and his hand were all messed up. Wolf was so pissed off that he found one of the guys who did it and shot him. After that wolf ran to the Zone and with time he gained respect and experience. That’s how he been came rookie leader we know today and even though today he barely goes out of cordon back in the day he would go deep into the Zone.
Do you know anything else?
All right, thanks for the info.
All right, beast, what are your orders?
Hey, what’s up?
I need you to patrol the base.
Sit back for a while, I don’t have any work for you right now.
Get back to base.
Nevermind.
I want to hire some extra security.
Tell me where you need the guard, so I can message him the location.
Excellent, Jackal has sent extra muscle form the nearst outpost.
I want to hire some extra security.
Okay, the price for the extra soldier is 2500 and you will have to pay out of your own pocket sense you are the leader. So what do you say? Are you hiring?
Okay, the price for the extra soldier is 2500 and you will have to pay out of your own pocket sense you are the leader. So what do you say? Are you hiring?
Okay, the price for the extra soldier is 2500 and you will have to pay out of your own pocket sense you are the leader. So what do you say? Are you hiring?
Yeah, here’s the cash.
Yeah, here’s the cash.
Yeah, here’s the cash.
Adminstration buliding, second floor.
Near the tunnel leading to dark valley.
Yard, south enterance.
Yard, north enterance.
All right, I need to go.
Okay, the price for the extra soldier is 2500 and you will have to pay out of your own pocket sense you are the leader. So what do you say? Are you hiring?
Yeah, here’s the cash.
No, I changed my mind.
Hey beast! What’s up?

The coordinator will be waiting for you in Bar No92 but I don’t know who is he or how does he look like, Jackal didn’t say, but he did say that he will approach you first. Perhaps we are finally going to get a serious mission, maybe Jackal finally decided to take us seriously.
What kind of jobs did you do before this one?
Small shit mostly, nothing too serious and the pay wasn’t that good either.
All right, I’ll go meet this coordinator, the more info I can get about this mission the better.
Hey, Beast! Do you have some buisness for me?

Yeah, I need you to contact Jackal and tell to send 4 fighters our way. Tell him that we need these soldiers for a security job at the bar and that if the op goes as planned we will get paid well but in the meantime we are not going to pay for them.

Jackal won’t be too happy to send troops without payment up front but he will go through as long as the pay is good. When the mercs come I will need to brief them on their mission so tell me what exactly they need to do.
They just need to guard the bar in the rookie village, nothing too compliacted. Just send them there when they get here.
All right, I do that. Once the mercs arrive, I will contact you.
Right then, see you later.
Hey beast! What’s up?
No, I changed my mind.
Excellent, Jackal has sent some extra muscle form the nearst outpost.
Alirght, I got to go.

Hey, Beast, even though Jackal won’t send any extra muscle for free, we can still pay him. We are low on manpower right now so I would suggest you ask Jackal too send us a few more troops if you have some extra cash. Who knows what these stalkers will try to pull next. Either way, I can contact Jackal any time so he could send some more men.
Hey beast! What’s up?
Greetings, Beast! Bizon told me that Sidorovich sent us the pay for his mission so does that mean you have news about the contract? Is there any work for me?
Yeah, I need to tell Jackal that Sidorovich needs two men to guard his bunker and that don’t have men spare, I think he’ll understand.
Got it, I get to it right now. By the way, almost forgot, Jackal said that the coordinator is ready to meet you and that he has a new job for us. Jackal said that you need to meet him personally.
That must be the secret mission that Jackal was talking about earlier… All right, where will this coordinator be waiting for me? I want to see what Jackal has in store for us.
Hello, Beast. Grief said that you talked to the coordinator. So what’s the job?
We need to “barrow” something from Sidorovich’s warehouse but before that we need to find a way to neutralize the technician.
All right, let’s start thinking… By the way, I found out who were those three dudes that came here a while back. They were Valerian’s men and they were sent here to found what we were doing here.
Good, that means they weren’t here on Sidorovich’s orders. I was getting worried for a second.

We tried to negotiate with them at first but you know how that turned out… Yeah, one of the stalkers we saved, Raccoon is his name, said that he wants to join the syndicate but I told him that his way too green.
And you did the right thing, although having a mole in the rookie village is not that bad.
Of what use will that stalker be to us? He could compromise our whole operation and we would have to spend days unfucking the mess that would come after.
Relax, I have a plan. Raccoon could help us with our current mission.
Hmm… What will be his task? He will probably get caught the minute goes anywhere near Valerian. What are you thinking?
We need to make Valerian leave the base and then we can kill him without witnesses.

So that stalker is only bait? I get it now: Valerian will find out that we sent an assassin after him and then he will try to escape and that’s when we kill him, right? Good plan, this could totally work.
Yeah, exactly, tonight we will see if my plan goes through. I’ve told grief to send a few guys to keep an eye on the stalker base.
All right, and what will you do now?
I’ll head back to the auto depot and wait for the message from the recon team, that’s all for now.
Hey, Beast, what’s up?

Raven, I need you to take two fighters and haul ass to the tunnel leading to Dark Valley. Valerian ate the bait, and he’s heading there as we speak. We are going to ambush him there. Come on, lets go!
Got it, Heading out now. Are you with us?
Yes.
Not now, I’ll head there in a little while.
You should probably talk to the hostage first.
You’re right.
Well, this checkpoint is ours. We’ll hold it until you decide what to do next. What about those stalkers, though? Can they go?
Yeah, they’re fine. Listen: my sniper rifle needs some adjustments. When we get back to the village, tell the technician to take a look. He should know what to do.
Gotcha. Are we heading back the the village?
Yeah, let’s go.
Just wait for a moment. I need to check something.
So are you ready to go?
Yeah, let’s go.

We’re in position, Beast. Another group just arrived in the Cordon, and they’ll be joining us in the assault. Everyone’s ready to go; the bandits won’t know what hit ’em. Before we go, though, can I ask you a question?
Excellent. Ask away, Raven.
Are you sure it’s worth it—risking our guys for a couple of nobodies? I doubt Wolf will pay a lot for this, considering the fact he’s probably not rich or anything.
I’m not really sure, but this is our best option at the moment. By carrying out this contract and saving those men, the people around here will recognize and trust us. We need that.
Got it. How’s the sniper spot I picked? I thought it matched your request. Plus, I couldn’t find anything better, so…
The position is perfect for my needs, Raven. Great place to test out this new sniper rifle.
Glad to hear it. Now let’s go over our plan one more time: I help our guys distract the bandits while you snipe them off one by one from up here. That right?
That’s our plan, all right. Now let’s do this.
I need medical attention.
Okay, let’s take a look…
[Next…]
All right, you’re good to go.
Okay, so you’re lever’s kind of swollen but that’s a professional hazard… Other than that though, you’re fine.
Can you refill my flask with water?
Yes, of course merc, no problem. However it will cost you a 1000. That might seem expensive but keep in my mind that it’s hard to filter out radiation out of water. So what do you think?
Yeah okay, Here’s the money and my flask.
Nah, changed my mind.
Sense this process takes time, I have a full flask ready for you, here you go and in meantime you can give me your old one so I can refill that. It’ll be ready by the time you come back.
All right, thanks.
I found a pda of “Final Day” will you pay anything for it?
Really? Is the pda encrypted?
Only partailly.
I’ll pay 10000 for it, no more.
Sure, here you go.
Here’s your cash, merc. Now let’s take a look…
He’s always alone and I doubt anybody hangs around him.
Where can I find him?
That’s a bit more difficult, I have no idea where he went but I have an idea. I’ll give you a GPS tracking unit and you will put it where I tell you. Then we will be able to track him down.
All right, give me that tracking unit.
Take it from the basement downstairs and plant it on the railroad bridge. I’ll send you the exact coordinates to your pda.
All right, I’ll go get it. Tell your guard to let me through.
Merc, don’t forget that you need to set up that tracking unit before I can find this “Klim” guy. All right, see you later.
Later.

Hello, merc. Let’s get straight to business, I take it you already know that you were hired for more than one job, right? Good. Not only have I managed to make a lot of enemies in the long time I’ve been here, but there are a lot of other things I need taken care of. Before we begin let’s establish a few rules that will keep you all from getting in to trouble. First of all, you know that stalker base over the railroad bridge; don’t go there because Valerian really dislikes mercenaries. Second, don’t do any business behind my back. Third and final, all of this must remain between us. Are we clear?
So merc, have you found the flashdrive yet?
Yeah, here it is.
Not yet.
Excellent, bring it here. Don’t bother telling me how you got it; I don’t care about the details. Tell me this though, the guy that was caring it, Is he dead?
Take the flashdrive… Yeah, you won’t have to worry about him ever again.
That’s good to hear… And that asshole thought he could rip me off. All right, let’s not waste any more time. You’re free to go for now, I’ll message you when I’ll need you.
Okay, now it’s time to do your part of the deal, pay me.
Hello merc, how are you? Listen, I didn’t call you for a job, instead I have a different offer for you.
Yeah? And what sort of offer would that be?
So it’s true what they say about you… All right, now hear out my rules, although it’s pretty much one rule. I get paid on time, right after the job is finished, no exceptions. Are we clear?
I need you to send me two of your guys to guard my bunker, I’ve been getting some extra heat recently, some people don’t like the way I do business.
Sure, I can send you a couple of guys. How much will you pay?
Hey, merc, have you forgotten the fact that I signed contract with your leader? I can remind you the hard way. Either way, I want two guards near my bunker as soon as possible. You got that?
Not a chance, I don’t have a lot of people as it is and the once I do are all busy and there’s no way in hell I am paying for your security out my own pocket.
I don’t loan cash!
Yeah whatever… I am not here for that. Did you hear anything about what happened last night?
No. What happened?

Something really strange, last night Valerian and his group went off somewhere and haven’t returned sense. No one can contact them via pda, they won’t answer, and those who remained at the base have no idea where Valerian could be.
Okay… And why are you telling me this?

You know, just making conversation. Thought maybe you know something, clearly though you don’t. Either way, in the meantime Valerian’s place is going to be taken by Orestes, an experienced stalker who just came back from a raid in Agroprom and he will be temporarily residing in the stalker base. I need you to give him something from me and don’t worry I talked to them, they will let you in.
I’m not your delivery boy, If you don’t have any real work then I’ll be on my way…
Listen here, you sellout piece of shit. Either you do what I tell you or I am cancelling the contract. Are we clear here?
Oh, all right, give me your package. Let’s get this over with.

I hope this is the last time you refuse to do your job. Here’s the package, give to Orestes personally, I told him you’d come. Also, Shaman was looking for you, he has a job for you. His in the bar right now so pay him a visit.
Bye.
I don’t loan cash!
I don’t loan cash!
Merc, don’t forget that you need to set up that tracking unit before I can find this “Klim” guy. All right, see you later.
All right, I’ll go get it. Tell your guard to let me through.
Fine, I’ll pay for your guys. 5000 for both of them, no more.
That’s more like it, they’ll be here ASAP.
Good work merc, the guys you sent are real professionals…
I Doubt you called me just for that so let’s get straight to the point.

Yeah, you’re right I also need to brief you on your first job. A while back a guy came here who wanted to sell some info to me but he the price he demanded was too high. The stalker’s name is Klim and he keeps the needed info in his flashdrive which he always carries with him. Your job is to get me that flashdrive and get rid of this Klim guy once and for all.
All right, what does this guy look like? Is he heavily armed?
No. He’s just some random trash with subpar gear. When he came here all he had was sawn-off shotgun and I doubt he had the time to get something better.
Does he have any friends? does he work in a group?
Tell me about yourself.

I always liked my independence and that’s why most of the time, I worked by myself and for myself and when I heard that the stalkers organized their own base, I knew I had to join in. You know, I’ve been in many places in the Zone and to me, being among independent stalkers is the best. There the only normal people around here, you feel me? They don’t have any “codes”, rules, or any other nonsense. They are just regular dudes trying to make a living and that’s the way it should be.
It’s really hard to come by good parts in the Zone… How do you manage to work with what you have?

Well, it’s not like I am upgrading gauss rifles over here but I can manage to get some decent work done. I’ve been doing this for many years now and I’m good at what I do. That’s pretty much it. Most stalkers don’t bring anything that complicated, mostly regular guns and armor that they need fixed. From time to time a stalker will ask for an upgrade and I can do that too. You can take a look at what upgrades I do, maybe you want something.
From what I undersatnd you’ve been around the Zone… Have you seen anything unusual on one of your trips?

Unusual? I came here from Agroprom when the big emission hit, you know, the one that changed everything. The things that happened after can only be described as miracles. A place that once was totally empty become a total shit show, part of the land there was all massed up with parts of it rising up, it was like something Salvador Dali drew and the radiation there was so strong that you couldn’t be anywhere near it without getting a lethal dose. The guys later told me that this anomaly was one of the most dangerous in the Zone and that it had the rarest artifacts. If you are ever near that place, beware…
Woah… Man, if it wasn’t for you, we would be dead right now! Raccoon and I are very grateful. It’s a good thing you came when you did… Who are you men, and why did you risk your lives for us?
We’re mercenaries. We were hired by Wolf to look for your squad. We found Zokhan, who told us of your location.
Zokhan’s alive? Oh, thank God! I thought he was dead for sure; I’m really happy to hear that!… Hey, can I ask you one more thing? Where are you going now?
Don’t worry. We’ll escort you back to the rookie village. After that, we’ll be on your way.
Good to hear. Those damn bandits took all of our gear, so we’re left with nothing… and walking around in the Zone without a gun isn’t exactly the smartest thing to do. So, we heading out?
Hold on a sec. I need to talk to my partner.
Hold on a sec. Let me tell my guys where we’re headed.
Yeah, let’s go.
Tell me about yourself.

I am trader who’s just starting out. When we came here not that long ago, Shaman said that everyone can pick what role they like, I wanted to be a trader. I have the talent for this job, I’ve been buying and selling things sense I was a kid. Back in school I used sell those old electronic games, you know the ones where there’s a wolf that catches eggs, an old soviet toy… Right now I am just trying to figure out how things work around here you know… Most of my products I get from Sidorovich so there’s not that much profit but hey slowly but surely I am starting to get my own clients so there’s that.

Man, right now we are living the good life. No more will the military try to steal our loot, now all of our earning will remain ours. Now after a deep raid we can actually rest easy in cordon and we can actually obtain good gear here. Hell, we can start making real money not like before when the minute a stalker would show up with a decent artifact the military would immediately take it from him. Maybe one day, we will drive out these jarheads out completely.
What do you think of about the life in Cordon right now?

Man, right now we are living the good life. No more will the military try to steal our loot, now all of our earning will remain ours. Now after a deep raid we can actually rest easy in cordon and we can actually obtain good gear here. Hell, we can start making real money not like before when the minute a stalker would show up with decent artifact the military would immediately take it from him. Maybe one day, we will drive out these jarheads out completely.
Fine, I won’t tell about this to anyone. What do you have?

Usually, bandits don’t go anywhere near that place, meaning that they had a special reason for being there. They must’ve being looking for something and we ran into them by accident. Their behavior was also really strange, I saw one of them drop a blue notebook when they were there, and I heard a few shots. After that, my vision went black, and when I woke up, I saw you. They must have taken the hostages and left.
Okay. And what do you suggest we do?
Can you go there, where you found me, and take a second look? Maybe you can find something. I have a gut feeling that those bandits were there for a reason. Don’t worry: I’ll pay up. You know me.
All right. I’ll see what I can find.
I have better things to do than waste my time looking for something only God knows.
Merc, I’m counting on you here, please, if you can, find some free time for this.
Fine… I’ll go there and see what’s what.
All right, but not right now.

You’re back… Thank you, you saved that guy’s life, if not for you, he would be dead. The bandits don’t hold hostages for long and the minute they see they are useless, they would kill them. Also, thanks for the medkit, it was a life savior. Was it hard to take down those scumbags?
So, Beast, have you found some time for the job yet? I’ll pay up good, you know me.
Fine… I’ll go there and see what’s what.
fine… I’ll go there and see what’s what.
Hey, Beast, What’s up?
Hello Beast, have you found the notebook?
Yeah, I found your notebook and I lost 25 grand in the process. Now I need that money back and your payment for the job which would amount in total to 30000. Any questions?

Yeah, I found the blue notebook and it had the coordinates of a meeting that was supposed to take place. in the meeting place I found a note that lead me to the tunnel under the railroad bridge. When I went there, I got jumped by some guy and he demanded 25 grand from me, so I iced him.
What? How? What exactly happened?
A sad turn of events, Yeah… I’m used to bullshit like this.
There isn’t that much to explain. I went to the tunnel and there was a bandit who tried to rob me, so I shot him.

That’s impossible, there’s a stalker base nearby so why would a bandit be anywhere near there. The bandits that hang around the northern checkpoint know full well not to go anywhere near that tunnel. This was done by someone else, I’m telling you. Did he tell you why he wanted 25 g’s? And how the hell did you know how to get to that tunnel anyway?

I found that blue notebook you mentioned before and in it the coordinates of the meeting were written down. When I went to the meeting place I found a note that said that someone will be waiting in tunnel at night. I went there and it turned out to be a trap. The guy stuck a gun to my chest and demanded 25k for some case.
We need quickly see what’s inside that case… Do you have it?

I have the case but it’s locked and there’s no way we are opening it without a professional lock picker. More than that though, the case is really light, like it’s empty, so I doubt that there’s anything valuable in it.
All of this is really strange… I need so what’s in that case, It might have some valuable info.
Fine, I’ll take care of cracking that case and you need to come up with the money that you owe me.
Hey, Beast, What’s up?

That’s impossible, there’s a stalker base nearby so why would a bandit be anywhere near there. The bandits that hang northern checkpoint know full well not to go anywhere near that tunnel. This was done by someone else, I’m telling you. Did he tell you why he wanted 25 g’s?

Too bad you guys didn’t come earlier; you would have saved a few more lives… either way though you saved lives today. Here, take this artifact, I found it in Garbage and I’ve never seen anything like it. I wanted to sell it to Sidorovich but you’ve earned it.
That cash must’ve been payment for that case, the one he brought.
We need quickly see what’s inside that case… Do you have it?

I have the case but it’s locked and there’s no way we are opening it without a professional lock picker. More than that though, the case is really light, like it’s empty, so I doubt that there’s anything valuable in it.
All of this is really strange… I need so what’s in that case, It might have some valuable info.
Fine, I’ll take care of the case. Keep in my mind though I am not giving contents of the case away for free.
Hey thanks man, If you ever need my help, you know where to find me.
Hey, Beast, What’s up?
Thanks. You said that you needed to talk to me about something, was it about the reward?
No, Beast, I need to talk to you about something else but you have to promise me that you’ll keep it between us. All right?
Dude, I already told you everything I know… Please, man… Give me a medkit.
Thanks a ton, man… Whew. Feeling better already. You saved my life… Wait, why are you here, anyway?
Wolf hired us to check up on your squad. I take it you’re the only survivor?

No. Two of us were taken hostage by the bandit attackers. I heard one of them say they need hostages for something, but I don’t know what the hell they’re planning to do. I’m fairly sure the hostages are still alive, though, so maybe there’s still a chance to rescue them.
Where did they take them?
The northern checkpoint; the one that leads to the Garbage. They set up a small base and everything, the bastards.
Got it. We’ll try to save them. And you should get back to the rookie village—this is no child’s play.
No, dude! I can’t just sit on my ass while my friends are in danger! I can shoot, and I’m already feeling better.
Not a chance, kid. Get back to Wolf. You’re wounded, and you won’t be of any use to us during the fight. We can handle a few bandits on our own, no problem.
Urgh… Fine. Just make sure you bring everyone back alive! I’m counting on you!
Sure thing. Now go see Wolf and tell him what happened while we prepare the assault.
Dude, help me… I’m bleeding here. Please…
After you answer a few questions. Then we’ll see what I can do.
Real funny… I can’t hold out much longer… Gimme a medkit…
No, I’m serious. Tell me right now: who the hell are you, and where is Wolf’s squad?

I’m Zokhan… As for the squad… you’re looking at it… We were ambushed by bandits, and they killed everyone… They left me for dead… We… We managed kill a few of them… but it wasn’t enough. There was too many of them… Dude, please, just give me a medkit.
All right. Here’s your medkit.
I don’t have any medkits. Sorry.
Well, it seems true to me.
First time I’m hearing about it.

It’s a well-known fact by now that what we call “zombies” are just people who completely lost their sanity and intelligence and yet people still endanger their mind in hopes of finding better loot, that’s human greed all right. Duty, for example, doesn’t even go anywhere near controllers, always keeping a kilometer between them and that dangerous mutant. They rather not risk their mental health; it’s just not worth it.
Yeah, scary shit…
So a Freedom stalker heard about Duty’s well known zoo…
Promising start…

God knows what was going in that freedomer’s head, but he got into his mind that he must see those mutants that were held up in duty’s zoo. Even though that guy was a good dude, it always seemed like he was too good. His honesty and loyalty had no limits and it was clear that it was only a matter of time before he does something really stupid. That’s why nobody was really surprised when the stalker said he was going to infiltrate duty’s base and attempt to free those mutants.
What was he thinking…

Sense it was Freedom, an anarchist faction, as long as nobody does anything to harm the faction itself everyone can do whatever they want. So they let the deluded freedomer continue with his crazy plan. Everybody said their goodbyes to him because they knew he was done for but our hero wasn’t as simple as he looked. I don’t know how but he managed to catch a live rodent so he could use it as a peace offering to Duty. So what do you think Duty did?
I doubt they invited him over for tea…

I don’t whether it was because the guards were in a forgiving mood or was it because the freedomer appeared totally harmless but they let him through. However, when the stalker got to Duty’s zoo is when shit hit the fan!

Too bad they couldn’t enjoy their victory for long. They were hit by a psi emission! It’s like the brain scorcher was living creature that suddenly realized they were there and wanted to get rid of them. When the psi emission hit, only one of the guys was zombified. He had a suit with a strong psi protection so he managed to survive that wave while the other guy’s brains frayed for good. Some say this happens a lot, where not everyone gets zombified at once. The guy whose brains were intact tackled his friend and dragged him towards red forest in hopes of saving his him…
Plotwists… Cool.

It turned out, that the freedomer was crazier than everyone thought. When he entered the zoo and saw the state the animals in he lost his shit.
