The animals were locked in small cages with barely an inch to move and there were so starved that they looked like scarecrows. The sight drove our hero mad so he started screaming at the top of his lungs and jumped on the zookeeper, inquisitor was his name, and started beating the shit out of him. At the same time Inquisitor wanted to put their newly obtained rodent at the rodent cage so the door to it was open so once the freedomer started assaulting him all the rodents escaped. The Duty soldiers of course shot the freedomer almost instantly…
Too bad… Poor fellow.

Though, he did manage to follow through on his plan. He exchanged his own life for the freedom of those rodents who escaped. They ran between the dutyers legs without them noticing untill finally the rodents found their way out of the base.
Not a bad story. All right,

Did you hear about the village, the one that’s near Radar and is in habited by bloodsuckers? Even though, everyone knows about that hellhole, I bet you don’t know why all the bloodsuckers flock there in first place.
Can’t say that I do…

Way back, before the big blowout that created the Zone, that village was inhabited by the military. Keep in mind though, these were no ordinary soldiers. They had some kind of different uniform with its own strange emblems. They were some kind of special unit. However what was their purpose no one knows for sure and it doesn’t matter much to our story. Anyway, when the big blowout hit almost all of the soldiers died instantly.
Sounds interesting but what does this have to do wtih the bloodsuckers?

However a few people managed to survive in that same village by hiding inside the cellars people used to store all the pickled goods. You know how our people are, we love our pickled shit and we can’t have enough of it.
I doubt he could accomplish anything but that’s some loyalty…
Well they had to come out some time didn’t they? They had to eat after all, it’s not like there was an unlimited supply of food in those cellars.

Yeah, you’re right. They had to come out of there at some point and they did. The soldiers would come out of the cellars from time to time to find some food and other supplies, grabbing whatever they could get their hands on. They didn’t have any detectors so they had no idea when they were walking through a radioactive field and they amount of radiation they took was enormous. But they had no other choice due to food supplies running so low.
Hell, there wasn’t much to do…

When they ran out of food completely, the soldiers resorted to cannibalism. What ensued was total nightmare. Those guys were so starved that they ate the people who were too weak to go on, their own friends, no less. But that’s not what’s important in this story, believe it or not but things get weirder.
I’ve have completely lost my appetite, and now you telling me things are going to get even weirder. This is the Zone after all, what else was I supposed to expect?

Yeah, the Zone is an unpredictable place and some even say that it’s a living creature. In the Zone some things don’t die out but rather adapt to it, revealing their ugliest form in the process. That’s what happened to our beloved soldiers, who instead of dying turned into the bloodsuckers we all know and love. The first generation of these mutants would wear a special soldier uniform, the same one as the guys that were stationed in the army warehouses wore. To this day bloodsuckers flock to that village… maybe they feel it’s their home. Who the hell knows what in the head of those overgrown ticks…
Man, I don’t even know what to say…

Yeah, trying to figure that out is a waste of time. The moral of this story is though, that sometimes it’s better to just accept your death instead of turning into a complete monster. The latter is a fate way worse than death.
Yeah, maybe you’re right… all right, I gotta go.
There was a time when The Barrier was totally unprotected and nobody was around to guard it.

Fate had more hardship in store for those two. All that noise attracted the attention of a monolith unit who was patrolling the area and saw the two stalkers. They opened fire the second they noticed them.
I like stories about the old days, keep going.

Back then, huge waves of monsters would run through the barrier and travel all the way to garbage. That’s why most stalkers preferred not to set camp anywhere near the radar barrier and the farthest place you could see stalkers camping was the bloodsucker village. But that village was no less dangerous as it was always occupied by packs of bloodsuckers. That’s how the place got its name, nobody knows why but those mutants would always flock to that village. Yet, even though the danger, stalkers would still in sleep in the houses of that village with one eye open.
Sounds like a story about me.

So one time, a certain screwball decided to spend the night on top of the tower that was located at the edge of the village. He claimed up, opened a bottle of vodka and slowly started drinking it whilst gradually falling asleep at the same time. Then all of a sudden, he saw a human silhouette in the distance, rustling around in the bushes. The stalker at the tower grabbed his rifle and his binoculars and got in better position to take his shot. For all he knew, it could have been a bloodsucker or a snork looking for some fresh prey or far worse a controller. However, it turned out be a regular stalker who was looking for a place to sleep the night.
He got lucky…

Our hero was happy to see another stalker in the area so he started throwing stuff out of the tower in hopes the other guy would see him. The stalker wondering around the village finally realized what was going on and went straight to the tower. Only the problem was this wasn’t a regular stalker but an experienced bandit with some serious gear.
Damn…

He was probably looking for a place where he could set up an ambush. Our hero didn’t beat around the bush and the minute he saw it was a bandit he opened fire on him. A serious firefight ensued between the two. The stalker threw a few grenades from the top of the tower but the bandit was a tough one and he avoided those grenades like a pro. After that the two started shooting each other from behind cover and the fight lasted for hours. Finally after long night of shooting the bandit fell on the ground…
I am guessing the bandit was dead…

No matter how you spin, the stalker had a better position in that tower. After he shot down the bandit he went down to check on the body. When he went inside the building where the bandit was hiding it and saw the body, he froze from shock. It turned out that the bandit didn’t die from a bullet but rather when they were busy shooting each other a bloodsucker snuck in and broke the guy’s neck. Before the stalker could even close his mouth, the bloodsucker killed him as well.
That was some luck out there.
The bloodsucker got a 2 for 1 deal.

If only those two would have just put their differences aside, they would have lived to fight another day. Instead of everyone going their own separate way in the morning, they are both dead and all for not. But that’s too much to ask for; we can’t help but shoot at each other.
Hey, sometimes people can help, only it’s not in Zone.
Man, have I got weird story for…
Things are werid enough already but I guess it can’t hurt.

One stalker went to the Zone to search for his beloved girl who was known to the people of the Zone as Sneguruchka. I don’t know why she got that nickname. She was average in the looks department, nothing special, although some say she had nice personality. The guy that was looking for her on the other hand was a total scumbag but that’s how it usually is. The good ones always fall for the bad ones.
Yeah, I think we’ve all seen an instance of that.

The two finally found each other and went to the bloodsucker village. You know the one in near the Army Warehouses. Bloodsuckers would always flock to that place for some reason but it was possible to survive there. That village had a group of stalkers there, a real bunch of assholes who would steal loot from dead bodies and sense this was the army warehouses a lot of experienced stalkers with good loot would die there. Sneguruchka and her boyfriend were members of said group and despite the fact that the girl felt sick from the whole thing she would stay there because she wanted to be with her boyfriend.
She was an idiot…

Hey, what can you do? You can’t pick who you love. Anyway, one time this group of raiders had disagreement about who gets what loot. As for our heroine, it was the worst day of her life. The raiders took out all of their frustration out on her by torturing and raping her. Thinking about it makes me sick. She was locked up in the water tower all day and night. However, strange things tend to happen in the Zone…

Just as it seemed the stalker and his friend were done for, things turned for the better. While the stalker was exchanging fire with the monolithians, his zombified friend stood up and instead of attacking the stalker he just stood and looked at him for a second and after that covered his friend from enemy fire with his own body thus saving him. The monolithians were shocked when it happened because zombies are supposed to be their biggest alley and yet here we are.
Hopefully, it would be something that would aid our heroine. Poor woman, being tortured like that.

A controller had entered the village and he had killed the majority of the group in a matter of seconds. The few that remained claimed up the tower and barricaded themselves from within. That didn’t help much though, obviously. The controller broke the door apart and slaughtered everyone inside but do you know what the strange part is?
What?

The controller didn’t touch the girl! Makes no sense but that’s what happened. He just left her there and ordered his zombies not to touch her. Nobody can explain why it happened the way it did it but the Zone saved the girl’s life, a real miracle.
I’m at loss for words…

The only thing we can know for sure is that this forsaken place we call the Zone doesn’t only destroy people but it helps people from time to time. The only thing that is certain is that nobody knows how the Zone works.
Risking your life for answers isn’t always the best solution, some things are meant to remain a mystery.
Sorry, I don’t have anything interesting right now… I ran out of stories.
Yeah, that is highly unlikely.

The zombie just kept covering his friend while his buddy was crawling towards the trees. When the stalker got to the tree they looked at each other for a second, and said their goodbyes non-verbally. After that the stalker ran away and managed to get back to the barrier. Sense then, that stalker never harms any zombies and instead just passes them by.
Yeah, I can kinda get him.
As for his zombified friend, some say that to this day he wanders around in radioactive forests and protects lost stalkers. And that meeting him is a sign that great fortune will come to you.
Hello, good sir, what brings you here? Everyone calls me Storyteller because I like to tell story whilst I drink some vodka. If you give me a bottle, I might tell you something interesting.
Even though the story ended with a bit of hope, it was still very depressing. All right, I got to go.
There are some people who have special talents and abilities out there. There was a stalker here who was totally immune to psy-emission. He could walk right through with out a scratch.
Let’s say that’s somehow poissble…

One might think that this stalker was some kind of zombie but that can’t be further from the truth. In reality, this stalker was actually were smart and used his gift well. He respected the Zone’s boundaries and he would never go to places he wasn’t supposed to. Sometimes he wouldn’t go past the scorcher at all despite being able to do that without any harm. He would bring unique artifacts from his raids which would earn him a lot of money. He never hesitated to help out a fellow stalker so most people respected him even though he had his share of enemies. But he was a good fighter and he always had good gear to boot so taking him down wasn’t easy and therefore most preferred not mess with him.
Go on…

He was also really careful. Despite being well equipped he would rather stay away from conflict. That’s why he made camp in one of abandon hangers in Yantar. The psy-emissions there were on full throttle and anybody who would go there would turn into a zombie instantly, unless it was our guy of course. How did he protect himself from the mutants and zombies though, I do not know. But he lived there pretty quietly.
Looks the guy was living the good life…

Everything would have been well and good except one time a controller came to those same hangers. Of course, try as it might, the controller couldn’t take control of the stalker but still it made his life miserable. Nobody knew for sure what went down there. He only mentioned his problem a few times, saying he tried to kill the controller a few times but that it got away. That’s not the main point of the story though…
What’s the point then? I’m dying to know…

One time a group of experienced stalker was moving through Yantar and they ran into that same controller. They were all good fighters so they decided to kill that creature for good. So then they carefully backed the controller into a corner and you know what happened then? That same stalker, who was living in Yantar, started shooting at the group from his sniper rifle. He managed to kill half them and the rest escaped. Who knows why he did it.
All right, heres a bottle… Tell me something interesting.
That stalker must’ve lost his mind.

The stalkers who travelled to Yantar have told stories about those two. They told that, even though the controller and that stalker were at each other’s throats all day, they would protect each other when there was an outside threat. Nobody could find an explanation to why this was happening and thus it was just considered another mystery in the Zone. After a while, the duo disappeared somewhere and nobody saw either one of them sense.
A mystery indeed, I don’t even know what to think.
Here’s what I think: If you have nemesis with whom you are at conflict for a very long time then you get used to them and then ending that relationship becomes very difficult.
I doubt that’s the case, but it’s possible.
I’ll tell you a story, if not necessarily scary then definitely creepy. I take it you heard about the “Concentration Camp” down in garbage.
Yeah, I heard about it.

I’ll tell you what: Garbage was always a god awful place. Even back before the incident in ’86 the place was used as dump were all the unneeded radioactive waste was thrown and buried. Near every junk heap there was a work station where the workers would dump the trash. However, the only station that remind to this day is the one we call the junkyard. Many people died there due working accidents and those that didn’t were afraid to talk about it, fearing that would be killed for talking too much. That’s why you don’t really hear about it. Anyway, after the incident Garbage was just left like that with all the junk and tools intact…
Go on…

Even back then there were death traps on every corner, ammunition exploding, gasoline in cars catching fire even and sometimes huge metal parts falling on people from out nowhere and killing them. Nobody could explain what was happening.
I’m not in the mood for stories.
Okay…

When the Zone emerged, everyone flocked to Garbage immediately, either just for artifacts or because it was a good place strategically. At first Duty tried to take over the place and make it safe for regular stalkers, getting rid of mutants and such. They would also deal with any stalker who was robbing and killing his fellow men.
Hey, its a decent thing to do.

Only it didn’t last for long. Duty made a small base inside an old bunker and would hide there during blowouts. Only one time when a blowout was coming they all ran inside their bunker to wait it out, only to find out they were trapped. The blowout changed the positions of all the anomalies in such way that they would block off every entrance to the bunker. All the duty members there died of starvation.
That’s a brutal way to die, wouldn’t wish it on my worst enemey.

What followed was no less brutal. At first, Freedom tried to make a base in Garbage but the constant mutant attacks at night prevented them from doing so. Regular loner stalkers also tried to establish something of a base for anyone who was coming back from a long trip to the Zone and needed to quickly resupply, get some sleep or to sell off some unneeded gear. But like everyone else they didn’t last for very long. One guy came back with a virus which he caught somewhere deep in the Zone and even though the stalkers figured out quickly that an infection was among them, the base still had to be turned into a quarantine area where no one could get in or out. As for the sick, they all died there.
Fucking horrifc…

Yeah, you said it. No matter what happened or who came over to this to this giant dumpster it always ended badly. As of now, the bandits are occupying garbage and the junkyard they call the concentration camp. Little do they know that the ones who are going to die soon are not only the stalkers they are holding prisoners but they themselves as well. Even though they are total assholes I still for sorry for them, they are still people after all.
Sure… All right, gotta go.

Even though women aren’t exactly common in the Zone and most stalkers only catch glimpses of them in porn mags but from time to time you can encounter a woman here. Not that you can expect anything good from them coming here, only problems. I have a story about a woman stalker…
All right, lay it on me.

Garbage which is now taken over bandits was once a place where experienced stalkers would go to get some rest after a long journey and resupply. The trader there was a chick named Matrona who would sell gear and food to those same stalkers, although her prices were through the roof but that only scared off the rookies. Other than that though, her business was doing very well and she would always cash out with a smile on her face. Also, she would drink a lot of vodka, she was a real alcoholic.
guilty conscience, perhaps?

Anyway, one time a guy was unlucky enough to fall in love with her! He ran after her all day and night bringing her gifts and shit. Sometimes he would even serenade her with his guitar during the evenings. Although, it annoyed everyone else so they made him wrap it up quickly. It was obvious the guy was totally obsessed with her.
Yeah, not the first time I’m hearing about a guy losing his head over a chick… What about Matrona?

She would only wink at him from time to time with her green eyes and milk him for all his goods. Everyone felt sick just watching it, even the bandits felt bad for the guy. But what can you do to help a guy in a situation like this? Not much. Everyone just shook their hands and waited until this mess would reach its awful conclusion.
So what was the conclusion?

Things ended badly. One time she was drunk as usual wondering around in garbage but thing was, that she was so drunk she couldn’t even see a vortex right in front of her. She couldn’t even realize what was going on before the anomaly ripped her to shreds.
Can’t feel much sympathy for her… What about our Romeo?

He completely lost his mind. He wanted to find the wish granter and wish her back so he went passed the barrier. After a while a few freedomers saw his zombified ass marching back from the barrier alongside a few monolithians and zombies. All that was left of him was shell with animal like tendencies and all humanity from him drained, like anyone else who tried to go past the barrier before him.
Hello, young man. If you share a bottle of vodka with me, I’ll tell you an interesting story.
Yeah, poor guy. All right, I’ll be on my way.
I’ll tell you a story about two guys who met up in the concentration camp.
I’m all ears.

The stalkers who, for the most, end up in concentration camp are those who had enough courage to visit Garbage but not enough money to pay the bandits. Because these stalkers can’t pay their “debt” for entering the bandit’s territory, they are forced to work their asses off looking for anything valuable in the junk heaps. This of course stops eventually when the bandits decide to kill their prisoners off. To this day that death prison is full of stalkers who didn’t have enough money to pay off the bandits. However, one time two individuals met up inside that camp that if they were anywhere else, then would have been at each other’s throat.
Go on…

The two dudes that I’m talking about were a dutyer and a freedomer! Why nobody tried to rescue them, I don’t know. Perhaps, it was because everyone thought they were dead or something. It’s not that hard to believe considering how many people go missing in the Zone every day. But that’s not the gist of this story…
So what’s the gist?

Those two decided to put their differences a side and plan an escape. They were the only two capable stalkers in the camp and nobody was going to know that they helped each other. So the two decided to put their principles aside and form an alliance and a pretty strong one, I might add. So after a while the two managed to escape from the bandits, while they were doing another one of their archeological digs.
So how did the manage to escape?

I don’t know for sure but I heard that they used an artifact as weapon. They found it in one of the junk piles and did something to it which turned it back into an anomaly. They say that if you spin an artifact in your hand the right way and poke it in the right places, it will turn back in to an anomaly. I can’t say for sure because I have no idea how to do this but I do know people who are experts in this craft.
I have a cool story for you. It starts with two good friends going in to red forest to look for those high tier artifacts and to hunt some big game.
That’s too bad…

Anyway, both of them managed to escape and ran to the nearest Freedom outpost. They could see the light at the end of the tunnel but alas fate played a cruel trick on them. A Freedom sniper saw the dutyer and took him out with one shot, a real tragedy. The freedomer was devastated and instead of running further away from the bandits he just sat there crying about his dead friend while the bandits were getting closer and closer. But you know what happened then?
Stop making me guess, just tell me.

Everyone died except for the freedomer who was on the run. The bandits and the freedomers at the outpost started fighting until they killed each other while our escapee was weeping over his dead friend. When the smoke cleared everyone was dead expect for him, I guess the Zone spared him for some reason. After that he left Freedom and became a total hermit who now spends his time exploring caves and other abandoned places in the Zone. Who knew things would turn out this way…
Yeah… Anyway, I got to go.
Have you heard anything about duty’s zoo?
Not much, I know it exists but that’s about it.

It’s a really weird and creepy place. Stuffed mutant cracusses gawk at you with their empty eyes while being lined up one after the other. The guy who organized this zoo, Inquisitor is his name, isn’t exactly normal as well as one might guess. I don’t know how much you know about that zoo but I bet you don’t how and why that guy organized that zoo in the first place.
All right then, tell me.

Legend has it, that he had a very expensive old watch gifted to him either by his granddad or great granddad. I don’t know for sure how he got that watch and it’s not that important. What’s important is that this watch was very valuable and therefore the Inquisitor would carry his timepiece with him at all time so that no could steal it.
Great start.
What does this have to do with the zoo exactly?

If you would stop interrupting I could actually to that. So one time the guy ran into a blood sucker in some dark alley and he barely managed to fight it off. He survived but so did the bloodsucker. Though, not only did the bloodsucker survive but he also managed to drag away the Inquisitor’s watch in his teeth… Or rather his tentacles or perhaps even he swallowed them whole… Who knows? Either way the Inquisitor lost something really valuable that day.
That’s kind of funny…

Our hero got really pissed that time. He then spent a few good days with his shotgun searching for his lost watch. He was so angry he committed bloodsucker genocide in there by killing at least a dozen bloodsuckers and slicing them open in hope of finding his lost wristwatch. He couldn’t find anything though, no matter how hard he tried.
Shit happens.

However, sense then that guy had developed a knack for capturing and dissecting mutants. It’s like he found some kind of hidden talent. Some say that to this day his looking for his lost watch but no ones for sure.
You know, if he would put out a decent reward for that watch, then people would find it in no time.
I know one thing for sure, that sometimes the bad things in life are fate’s way of setting us on the right path. Just like the Inquisitor who after losing his watch, found his new talent.
I doubt that. Bad shit happens to me all the time and it hasn’t yielded any benefit.
Have you ever been to duty’s zoo?

They got pretty far and they’ve collected a lot of good loot along the way but greed got the better of them and they decided to keep pushing further. So they kept pushing and inch by inch they wandered right into the brain scorcher area. You can be sure that those two were paralyzed from fear when they saw those antennas over the horizon…
I heard about it…

It doesn’t matter that much to be honest. The important part is that the zoo doesn’t have a controller’s stump in it and by the looks of it all, it never will. Obtaining an intact body of a controller is just way to dangerous and there’s no way the leader will allow for such thing after the last incident.
So what’s the point of this story?

The point is that once duty tried to obtain an intact carcass of a controller, the first one they could find. They wanted to shoot him with a sniper rifle between the eyes and thus leaving most of his body intact. They knew of a controller lair not far from their base in a nearby forest. The mutant was living in a small cave and it would only come out at night to hunt for food. So the dutyers decide that it’s an easy target and sniping it from a far won’t be a problem.
Yeah, I hunted a few controllers for a few clients.

So then a squad of dutyers made camp on top of a helm not far from the controller’s lair. Their Plan was just to wait for the controller to come out of his cave and then snipe him. However, despite them waiting for a few days straight, the controller didn’t come out of his home, it’s like he knew they were there. Slowly but surely the squad was running out of food and water however the dutyers didn’t want get back to base empty handed so they continued waiting.
Bad move.

That’s for sure. They couldn’t occupy their new position in time and the controller managed to fry up their brains. The controller turned out to be an experienced one and could easily sense that he was being watched by a group of stalkers. Everyone was zombifed expect for one guy who barely managed to escape and even he suffered some serious brain damage. Sense that hunting trip, that guy can’t even speak normally. He constantly stators, he cannot even finish a sentence.
Well, we all have our battle scars.

The gist of this story is that one of the stalkers that were zombified in that hunting trip was the brother of Krilov, the leader of duty. When Krilov found about this he strictly prohibited anybody from going anywhere in that lair. Thing is Krilov doesn’t want one anyone killing his brother because he is hoping that one day scientists can find the cure for zombification and save his sibling.
I’m here about the instruments.
What about them?
I used to bring Wagon instruments.
Yeah, if you find anything, bring it here.
All right.
I brought some instruments.
Cool, which type?
For basic work.
Excellent! Now if only you’d bring me tools for fine work and for calibration.
For fine work.
Excellent! Now if only you would bring tools for basic work and for calibration.
Tools for calibrtion.
Excellent! Now if only you would bring tools for basic and fine work…
Nothing yet.
Awesome! Now if you’d bring tools for calibration and I’d be all set.
Awesome! Now if you’d bring tools for fine work and I’d be all set.
Awesome! Now if you’d bring tools for basic work and I’d be all set.
Nice! Where did you find them?
If you need instruments then I can help you find them.

That’d be great! It feels like I’m in the Stone Age with my current tools. The only modern thing I have here is a soldering iron and even it isn’t that good. Now if you would bring the right tools then I could really start making some serious upgrades.
Okay, I’ll try to find something.
I changed my mind.
All right, I need upgrades and you need tools so It’s a win win situation.
Hey, you still need those tools?
Of course I do! Show me what you got.
I got tools for basic work.
Great, now can start modifying weapons and arms.
I got tools for fine work.
Great, now can start working on adavanced upgrades.
I got tools for calibration.
Excellent! Now can turn your gun into high powered killing machine.
Nothing yet.
Sidorovich, turn off the radio.
All right, I’m sick of it myself.
Sure. What, you got a headache?
What, You don’t like my music? So be it.
Sidorovich, Turn on the radio.
You want some music? Sure, here you go.
All right, I am also in the mood for some music.
Sure, here you go. Listen to your hearts content.
Anything interesting around here?

Not really. This place is mostly for rookies and for people who came back from long trips looking to sell of their loot. There’s the army outpost south of here so beware of them. North of here there’s a road leading to Garbage.
Tell me about the rookie village.

There’s not much to say. This is where most rookies end up but after gaining some money and experience they move further north. This place is sort of the starting point for stalkers and anybody who isn’t total wimp leaves this place after a short while. There are some idiots who stay here because they can’t handle themselves anywhere else in the Zone but that’s about it. From time to time you can see an experience stalker walking through here to sell their loot to Sidorovich and to get some rest in a quiet place for a few days.
How about the military, do they bother you?

Not really. We sort of have a non-verbal agreement, we don’t bother them and they don’t bother us. They say themselves that they rather not risk their lives fighting with stalkers who will mostly likely die in anomalies any way. And it’s the same for us, we rather not get in their way. When the military is doing a raid or looking for something we move out of the way and let them do their job.
Tell me about Sidorovich.

He is the go to trader in Cordon. His main clients are rookies who only recently got to the Zone. He has lots of connections in and outside the Zone. They say he started trading in his youth and that He sold weed when he was in college. He’s highly respected by stalkers for his honest business but at the same time he’s disliked for his greed and selfishness. One thing’s for sure he gave a lot of stalkers an opportunity to survive and without him they would probably be dead. He also has the richest business in Zone. If Sidorovich doesn’t have something then you’re not going to find it anywhere else.
Tell me about yourself.

I’m sort of a leader here. I teach the rookies how to live and survive in the Zone. As for me I had enough time to wonder around the Zone and I am sick of it. I came here to cordon, to leave the Zone a long time ago but sense then something has been holding me here, like I’m under a spell or something. Every time I try to leave something gets in the way, either the military is doing a raid or blowout starts at the wrong time. Sometimes I get offered a job so good you can’t pass it by.
Tell me about this place.

Right now we are in Cordon, the Zone’s border. Down south there’s an army outpost which guarding the entrance to this place and further north there’s a road leading to Garbage. This place still somewhat resembles the outside world sense there are barely any artifacts or anomalies here. You can see some wild boars here once in a while but other than that it’s totally quiet. Well it’s quiet in comparison with the rest of the Zone that is.

This place is mostly for rookies and for people who came back from long trips looking to sell of their loot. There’s the army outpost south of here so beware of them. North of here there’s a road leading to Garbage.
Lead the way.
